words.definition: If something is congested, it is full or blocked.
words.example: Tom didn’t get home until after dark because the road was so congested.

words.definition: A courier is someone who takes and delivers mail or packages.
words.example: Before trains, most couriers used horses to travel.

words.definition: To deform something means to change it from its correct or original shape.
words.example: The computer program deformed the building’s picture into an unreal sight.

words.definition: Etiquette is the group of rules about how to be polite.
words.example: When in Asian countries, bowing is a form of etiquette.

words.definition: If something is exclusive, it is expensive and only for rich people.
words.example: The golf course was so exclusive that most people hadn’t even heard of it.

words.definition: Freight is a set of items carried on a train, boat, or airplane.
words.example: Trade ships only carried valuable freight like silk and spices.

words.definition: A garment is a piece of clothing.
words.example: The business man had all of his garments cleaned before the important meeting.

words.definition: Insomnia is a condition in which a person has difficulty sleeping.
words.example: Nate’s insomnia prevented him from getting enough rest.

words.definition: Intuitive is knowing about something without naturally having support or proof.
words.example: Rhonda had an intuitive feeling that something was wrong.

words.definition: If you are liable for something, you are legally responsible for it.
words.example: The company is liable for any damage caused by its products.

words.definition: To obsess about something means to think about it all the time.
words.example: He obsesses about his health.

words.definition: If something goes overboard, it falls off a boat into the water.
words.example: The sailor fell overboard during the storm.

words.definition: A premium is an amount of money you pay for something like insurance.
words.example: She pays a high premium for her health insurance.

words.definition: A privilege is a special right given to a person or group.
words.example: It was a privilege to meet the president.

words.definition: To propel means to push something forward.
words.example: The wind propelled the boat across the lake.

words.definition: To socialize means to spend time with other people for fun.
words.example: She likes to socialize with her friends after work.

words.definition: To suppress something means to stop it by force.
words.example: The government suppressed the rebellion.

words.definition: A tram is a vehicle like a bus that runs on rails in a city.
words.example: I took the tram to get to the city center.

words.definition: To unsettle someone means to make them feel anxious or worried.
words.example: The news of the accident unsettled her.

words.definition: To warp means to bend out of shape.
words.example: The wood warped because of the heat.
